title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 22, subtit. D, ch. VII, subch. A, Surrogate's Forms, form A-2 - Citation
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 22, subtit. D, ch. VII, subch. A, Surrogate's Forms, form A-2 - Citation

State Regulations
ADMINISTRATION CITATION File No. ________
SURROGATE'S COURT - ________ COUNTY
CITATION
THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW
YORK, By the Grace of God Free and

Independent, TO ________
A petition having been duly filed by
________, who is domiciled at ________
YOU ARE HEREBY CITED TO SHOW CAUSE before
the Surrogate's Court, ________ County, at ________, New York, on ________, 19________, at ________ o'clock in the ________ noon of that day, why a decree
should not be made in the estate of ________ lately domiciled at ________ in
the County of ________, New York, granting Letters of Administration upon the
estate of the decedent to ________ or to such other person as may be entitled
thereto. (State any further relief
requested)
____________
____________
HON. ______________
Surrogate

Dated, Attested and Sealed, ______
(I) [FN3] ( ____________ and I jointly and
severally) undertake that defendant will appear in
______________
Chief Clerk

Name of

Attorney for Petitioner ____________ Tel. No. ________
Address of Attorney ____________
Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 22, subtit. D, ch. VII, subch. A, Surrogate's Forms, form
A-2

This citation is served upon you as
required by law. You are not required to appear. If you fail to appear it will
be assumed you do not object to the relief requested. You have a right to have
an attorney-at-law appear for you. State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
